content: All reagents were used directly without further purification. ZIF-67 and titanium butoxide were used as precursors for preparing SZC@TiO2 catalysts. The detailed synthetic method is provided in the Supporting Information. The formation of SZC@TiO2 catalysts through a versatile kinetics-controlled coating method is schematically illustrated in a. The as-prepared ZIF-67 (1 g) was impregnated in ethanol (150 mL) with 0.9 mL of ammonia solution (25 wt %), and the obtained solution was blended adequately under ultrasonic treatment for 30 min. Titanium butoxide (10 mL) was then added dropwise for 10 min, and the reaction proceeded at 45 °C for 12 h under continuous stirring. This mixture was then put into a 200 mL Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave at 180 °C and maintained for 12 h. The resulting precipitates were filtered and washed with ethanol and finally dried in a vacuum at 70 °C for 4 h. Subsequently, the composite was heated to 450 °C at a heating rate of 2 °C·min–1 in an N2 atmosphere and maintained at 450 °C for 2 h. Activated SZC@TiO2 powder (0.50 g) was immersed in 50 mL of 1 M sulfuric acid for 12 h. The resulting precipitates were filtered and washed with H2O and finally dried in a vacuum at 70 °C for 4 h.
clean_text:
Experiments

Catalyst Synthesis

All reagents were used directly without further purification. ZIF-67 and titanium butoxide were used as precursors for preparing SZC@TiO2 catalysts. The detailed synthetic method is provided in the Supporting Information. The formation of SZC@TiO2 catalysts through a versatile kinetics-controlled coating method is schematically illustrated in a. The as-prepared ZIF-67 (1 g) was impregnated in ethanol (150 mL) with 0.9 mL of ammonia solution (25 wt %), and the obtained solution was blended adequately under ultrasonic treatment for 30 min. Titanium butoxide (10 mL) was then added dropwise for 10 min, and the reaction proceeded at 45 °C for 12 h under continuous stirring. This mixture was then put into a 200 mL Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave at 180 °C and maintained for 12 h. The resulting precipitates were filtered and washed with ethanol and finally dried in a vacuum at 70 °C for 4 h. Subsequently, the composite was heated to 450 °C at a heating rate of 2 °C⋅min-1 in an N2 atmosphere and maintained at 450 °C for 2 h. Activated SZC@TiO2 powder (0.50 g) was immersed in 50 mL of 1 M sulfuric acid for 12 h. The resulting precipitates were filtered and washed with H2O and finally dried in a vacuum at 70 °C for 4 h.
